metadata.title: CVE-2017-7484 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
It was found that some selectivity estimation functions in PostgreSQLbefore 9.2.21, 9.3.x before 9.3.17, 9.4.x before 9.4.12, 9.5.x before9.5.7, and 9.6.x before 9.6.3 did not check user privileges beforeproviding information from pg_statistic, possibly leaking information. Anunprivileged attacker could use this flaw to steal some information fromtables they are otherwise not allowed to access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7484` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.1-1
libecpg6 - 10.1-1
libpgtypes3 - 10.1-1
libpq5 - 10.1-1
postgresql-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.1-1').
